intro: Condylostylis vignoides, commonly known as the slender mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that belongs to the family Loranthaceae. It typically grows on the branches of host trees, such as those in the families Euphorbiaceae and Myrtaceae. The plant has small, opposite leaves and produces white or pale yellow flowers that are often clustered together. Its fruit is a small, fleshy berry that contains one or two seeds. Condylostylis vignoides plays a role in ecological interactions by providing food for certain bird species and contributing to the biodiversity of forest ecosystems.
